awd_titl_txt: Graduate Engineering Education at the City College for      Women, Minorities, and/or Persons with Disabilities:        Project FORCE
awd_abstract_narration: The program at City College of the City University of New York                  builds on an established base of female and minority bachelor's and             master's degree engineering students and on successful programs for             recruitment and retention to establish a new program of doctoral,               graduate study and research traineeships for underrepresented                   students.  The program is entitled project FORCE (Focused                       Opportunities For Research Careers in Engineering).  FORCE involves             specially selected faculty research mentors from each of the                    engineering departments.  The four student participants                         will receive special advising, counseling and other support                     services designed to improve their retention in the program and                 enhance their potential for a successful research career.  They                 will have a mandatory internship experience in industry during the              summer prior to their matriculation as graduate students.                       Subsequent summer internships will be optional.
org_div_long_name: Division of Engineering Education and Centers

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: RESEARCH FOUNDATION OF THE CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK
